 BlinkIT Grocery Sales Analysis using SQL

## Overview
This project provides a deep-dive analysis of BlinkIT's grocery sales dataset using SQL. BlinkIT is a prominent online grocery delivery platform, and the dataset includes detailed item-level and outlet-level information, such as product types, fat content, visibility, outlet size, location, and more.

## Project Objective
The goal is to clean the data, perform exploratory data analysis (EDA), and extract insights that would be valuable to business stakeholders for decision-making—such as understanding sales patterns, product performance, customer ratings, and outlet effectiveness.

## Tools Used
SQL (Oracle SQL / PostgreSQL compatible) – for querying, cleaning, and analysis
Excel – as the data source (converted into SQL table)

## Key SQL Skills Demonstrated

Data Cleaning and Standardization (UPDATE, CASE, NULL handling)

Aggregation and Grouping (SUM, AVG, COUNT, GROUP BY)

Window Functions (RANK, OVER, PARTITION BY)

Conditional Logic (CASE, IF, nested queries)

Common Table Expressions (CTEs) for advanced filtering

Real-world business problem solving using SQL

## How to Use This Project
Import the dataset (BlinkIT Grocery Data.xlsx) into your SQL database.

Run Data Cleaning.sql to clean and prepare the dataset.

Execute EDA.sql to explore trends and patterns.

Modify or expand queries to fit business questions.

## Dataset Used is from Kaggle -
